bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, August 3, 1942

div1.p: Hench sends Rodriguez Leon items related to Cornwell's yellow fever painting and informs her that he is entering the army medical corps this week. He hopes she will continue to write to him.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, August 3, 1942
div1.opener:
August 3, 1942
Senora Estela Agramonte Rodriguez-Leon
Calle 15, No. 311
Vedado, Havana
Cuba
My dear Senora Rodriguez-Leon:
div1.p:
By separate post I am sending you
three little items which may interest you and show
you how they are familiarizing people with the yellow
fever painting.

This week I enter the Army Medical
Corps on active duty. But please write me occasionally
through my Mayo Clinic Address. The example which
your father and his associates set for the medical
corps will be remembered by me always.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P.S. Hench, M.D. PSH:as
Medeca
Wyeth otte &payables
